TaskDescription.Detail: Open a new Excel file to input, edit, and save data.

Assist.value: You can designate a variable to contain the opened Excel file. Store in RESULT by default.
Specifies whether to make the Excel document visible on the screen when opening it. When activated, the Excel file becomes invisible.
Write a string in the Excel file.
Specifies the Excel to control. If ACTIVE_EXCEL is specified, the most recently opened Excel file is controlled.
Specifies the string to be input. Input 'test'.
Specifies the range to input the string. Input 'E2:F2'.
Change a specific string in the Excel file.
Specifies the string to find. Input 'test'.
Specifies the string to be replaced. Input 3 (number).
Input the area of ​​the cell where the string is to be changed. Leave the default ('1:1048576') to target the entire area.
Write a value in the area specified in the Excel file.
Specify the values ​​to be input as an array. Input this.data. (The variable is assigned a value to be Input.)
Input the cell address to start typing. Values ​​are Input from 'A1'.
You can copy and paste a specific area of ​​the Excel file.
Specifies the Excel handler with the area to be copied. In this tutorial, we will copy and paste from an open Excel file. Input ACTIVE_EXCEL.
Specifies the Excel handler with the area to be pasted. Input ACTIVE_EXCEL.
Specifies the area to be copied. Input 'A2:C4' to copy existing data.
Specifies the pasted area. Input 'A5:C7', the area below the existing data.
Delete a row in the Excel file.
Specifies the position of the row to be deleted. Input '7' to delete a line.
Specifies the path to save the file. Input Global.ProjectDir + 'test.xlsx' to save to the current project path.
Close the Excel document opened in the background.
Specifies whether to force quit. Please enable it to force quit.
